Hope Mikaelson, a tribrid daughter of a Vampire/Werewolf hybrid, makes her way in the world." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt8103070/","name":"Legacies","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmMwNDczMDUtNDU0Mi00MjIyLWI1NTktNzM4Yzc1MTNmZDIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTQ0NTEzMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hope Mikaelson, a tribrid daughter of a Vampire/Werewolf hybrid, makes her way in the world.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8103070/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jessica-goetjes"},"dateCreated":"2018-11-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a show for teens, but an okay one","reviewBody":"I think Tvd took off as a teen show, but developed as the character grew older. I hope that's what they intend with this show as well. And also would be nice if there is a developing red line in this show, as for now they are problem solving like a supernatural detective show. The originals was definitely not only for teens. So it wonders me a bit that we are back to high school drama. Anyway it is not a bad show, but there are some flaws. By example the behaviour of the Gemini twins. They could be stronger having less emotional teen drama. Maybe a little more evil in the show as well... it needs a character like Damon or Klaus I guess. Anyway it's nice entertainment. Let.s see how it develops.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":26459,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Adventure","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2018-10-25","keywords":"lesbian,vampire,witch,high school,spin off","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5994559/","name":"Danielle Rose Russell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7263948/","name":"Aria Shahghasemi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7875835/","name":"Quincy Fouse"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0429120/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142434/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0687096/","name":"Julie Plec"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 4 Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3129328409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRjMjZjNmYtN2MwOS00ZDY5LWExMzEtYTM4YTc5MmUxMjk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFuaW5vc2M@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWRjMjZjNmYtN2MwOS00ZDY5LWExMzEtYTM4YTc5MmUxMjk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFuaW5vc2M@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

Spides
programme.desc: Spides: Created by Rainer Matsutani. With Rosabell Laurenti Sellers, Désirée Nosbusch, Falk Hentschel, Francis Fulton-Smith. Murders, disappearances, and strange occurrences begin piling up in connection with the appearance of a new club drug called "Blis"." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt8629136/","name":"Spides","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjcyZjZiMjItMmZmNS00NTEwLTg4NmItOWQyZGNmMThmOTk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjcyMDk5OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Murders, disappearances, and strange occurrences begin piling up in connection with the appearance of a new club drug called "Blis".","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8629136/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mcintyre64"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very Interesting Weird Show","reviewBody":"The opening credits and how its set in Germany reminds me of Dark which is one of my favourite TV shows of all time. It is also a little bit like Fringe. However there is no time travel or alternative universes in this yet. But I can see how i like it based on these two TV shows; there is a lot going on and you want to keep watching to see what happens. Acting may be a little mechanical and not as much depth to some characters that I would like but it looks good and is an interesting weird idea. I hope they do more Seasons and hope it maintains its good level.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"genre":["Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2020-03-05","keywords":"drug","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3065809/","name":"Rosabell Laurenti Sellers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0636440/","name":"Désirée Nosbusch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1571804/","name":"Falk Hentschel"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0783904/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0314952/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0683188/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0559668/","name":"Rainer Matsutani"}]}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
Hellboy 2
programme.desc:
Hellboy II: The Golden Army: Directed by Guillermo del Toro. With Ron Perlman, Selma Blair, Doug Jones, John Alexander. A prince of the mythical world starts a rebellion against humanity in order to rule the Earth. Hellboy and his team must fight to stop him from locating the all-powerful Golden Army." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0411477/","name":"Hellboy II: The Golden Army","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA5NzgyMjc2Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTU3MDI3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A prince of the mythical world starts a rebellion against humanity in order to rule the Earth. Hellboy and his team must fight to stop him from locating the all-powerful Golden Army.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0411477/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vip_ebriega"},"dateCreated":"2009-12-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Take another trip to Del Toro's labyrinth.","reviewBody":"My Take: An elaborate set of imaginative creature effects and the always interesting lead character make the show worth watching.

I have a confession to make: I haven't seen the original HELLBOY yet. And neither have I seen it when I saw the much-praised sequel HELLBOY II: THE GOLDEN ARMY. But that's just what I really like about this sequel: It doesn't require you to have seen the original to fully enjoy this weird and entertaining excursion. Seeing the original would certainly add to the experience, but taken in its own rights, HELLBOY II does what a sequel should do: Not just live up to the expectations left by its predecessor, but also shine as a stand-alone effort.

And yet I have another confession: I have not seen Guillermo Del Toro's crown jewel PAN'S LABYRINTH yet. But seeing HELLBOY II, I am more than impressed by his wild imagination. HELLBOY may have been based on a comic book, but for anyone who isn't a fan of the comics, Hellboy is Del Toro's own creation. Like what Tim Burton did with BATMAN, Del Toro has modeled Hellboy (Ron Perlman) as his own creation on-screen, and he's a very interesting character. Perlman never wastes his opportunity to provide depth as well as nuance to his character. Perlman proves himself worthy, not just an ideal action hero (under tons of make-up), but as yet another actor who successfully embodies the role of a comic-book character.

As in PAN'S LABYRINTH, Del Toro populates the world of HELLBOY II with some truly fascinating and intriguing creatures. Roger Ebert made a truthful compliment by stating that the world of HELLBOY II reminded him of the famous Cantina scene from STAR WARS. What George Lucas has conceived within only a few minutes of screen time in his movie, Del Toro manages to do for 2 hours. The creatures are imaginative, not just in look but in personality, and they are at an abundance. Plus, they're also mostly done using make-up effects rather than CGI, which makes them all the more real. Add to Del Toro's imaginative set pieces, he is a master storyteller. From the opening scene, where "Broom" Bruttenholm (John Hurt) tells the legend of the "Golden Army" to a young Hellboy, Del Toro exhibits is true talents at telling a good story. There are moments of thrills and even laughs, and the visuals are superb. Supporting performances and some neat special effects (notice that I praised the CGI later in in this review) make for one worthy adventure ride. HELLBOY II isn't perfect, but it sure is great at what it was doing.

Rating: **** out of 5.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":264421,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2008-10-08","keywords":"superhero,twins,friendship,cat,elf","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. teaser trailer: Hellboy II: The Golden Army","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1588723993","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTIwMDU5MjI5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjM2ODc5._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTIwMDU5MjI5N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwMjM2ODc5._V1_.jpg","description":"This is a teaser trailer for Hellboy II: The Golden Army, directed by Guillermo del Toro"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000579/","name":"Ron Perlman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004757/","name":"Selma Blair"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0427964/","name":"Doug Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020061/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0239918/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0586005/","name":"Mike Mignola"}],"duration":"PT2H"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: King Kong
King Kong
programme.desc:
King Kong: Directed by Peter Jackson. With Naomi Watts, Jack Black, Adrien Brody, Thomas Kretschmann. A greedy film producer assembles a team of moviemakers and sets out for the infamous Skull Island, where they find more than just cannibalistic natives." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0360717/","name":"King Kong","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjYxYmRlZWYtMzAwNC00MDA1LWJjNTItOTBjMzlhNGMzYzk3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A greedy film producer assembles a team of moviemakers and sets out for the infamous Skull Island, where they find more than just cannibalistic natives.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0360717/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tedg"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Tempest","reviewBody":"We can all celebrate. Jackson has now solidly replaced Spielberg.

Most folks know that the 1933 "Kong" changed the world in fundamental ways. The world of movie imagination was in its earliest phases, so quite apart from the innovations of animation and dramatic scoring, the engineering of the narrative was radical and important -- the idea of making a movie about making a movie. Was it the first major film with such explicit folding?

It is a movie about the making of a movie that gets out of hand so the inner movie takes over the enclosing one. Then a larger crew gets involved and subdues the "beast" (the energy of the thing) and recasts it as a slightly different type of show, the "real" thing. This also gets out of hand in the same way. The form is nominally a beauty and the beast love story, but inside it is a similar beauty and the beast story about the notions of dangerous storytelling.

Fortunately, we have the Jackson of "Forgotten Silver," "Heavenly Creatures" and "Meet the Freebles," all in this family of reflection.

This Kong sets the human lover as the actual playwright who (literally) is writing what we see as we go along. He intends to be outside the play, but gets swept up in it as the venture (again, literally) leaves with him aboard. When looking for an actress, Denham asks about Fay, and is told she is filming something for RKO, the original Kong, in fact.

The big layer is that when the Kong show comes to 1933 New York, the costumes and music are from the 1933 film. How clever, to overlap the layer of original-remake with that in the story of movie within layered on the "real" thing. The business about the monster coming off the stage/screen and entering the audience is a fold-shifting device visited many times since.

I understand there are a quite a few more subtle 'movie within the movie" touches that Jackson intends to add in the DVD cut. We see one in the trailer where the inner filmmaker is directing Ann to scream. 

Jackson cleverly adds in a few narrative references as well. This is an intelligent filmmaker, after all. The obvious one is "Heart of Darkness," (and by reference, "Apocalypse Now"), which he slips in explicitly and then satirizes by that quaint foolishness of the mentor and lost boy.

But the insertion he makes that is not explicit is the one that fascinates me: "The Tempest," sort of a touchstone for this notion of folded narrative and how it is added as yet another layer is a pleasant surprise.

If (shame) you don't know the Tempest, here is an outline: a magician (Shakespeare who is both in the play and writing it) lives on a lost island with magical creatures. He conspires to raise the titular tempest which brings a shipload of folks to the island where he works his magic. His conjuring of the tempest presumably goes back in time to include all the events leading to the reasons the people are on the ship.

The tempest involves an enveloping fog, rocks that appear from nowhere and no escape for experienced mariners.

Once on the island, there are a few plays-within-plays created and manipulated by the magician, some exposure to the feral animal energies of the place, and a love between a young couple. There's much ado about the abject loneliness of our magician.

(Incidentally, implicit in this Kong story is that this monster ape is the very last in the line. When he takes his new love to see the sunset, he takes her past the family boneyard. There, you can see that there was a long line of giants before him that at each stage had a loved companion where he does not.)

Quite apart from that, you can see Ted's law at work here and in "The Tempest." That law holds that when you have two layers, a film and a play or film within, the distance of abstraction between us and the outer film is the same as that between the outer film and the inner one. This is true in the four explicit inner plays: the movie Denham makes, the play Jack writes (where he talks to himself about love), the Kong show (which references the 33 movie) and the stage performances Ann does throughout, including for Kong (which is pure Jackson).

All this business about narrative dimension is mirrored in the physical dimensions as well. Jackson knows how to work in the three dimensions that animation gives him the freedom to exploit. At least we got that out of his adventures with fascist romantic cosmology. If you just watched the fight between Kong and the two dinos suspended by vines as they and we swoop about, you'd get your money's worth. And that would be both in entertainment and knowing you are seeing something that will change all action movies that follow. The planes at the end have camera perspectives we haven't seen before as well.

This is a masterwork. My one complaint is the lack of sex. Yes, I know. Mooneyes are enough, and anything more works against the abstraction of the thing. But that business about smell in the 33 version was piercingly raw and human. It is a shame that to sell big it had to be replaced with some business about her "entertaining" him. But it does keep the performance levels straight.

Ted's Evaluation -- 3 of 3: Worth watching."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":410409,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2006-01-25","keywords":"gorilla,king kong,island,new york city,jungle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4100440345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2E5YjhlYzgtZWY2Yy00NDYwLTgyMjUtODI4ZDBmNTkzNWVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2E5YjhlYzgtZWY2Yy00NDYwLTgyMjUtODI4ZDBmNTkzNWVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A greedy film producer assembles a team of moviemakers and sets out for the infamous Skull Island, where they find more than just cannibalistic natives."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915208/","name":"Naomi Watts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004778/","name":"Adrien Brody"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001392/","name":"Peter Jackson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046203/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0135516/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0909638/","name":"Fran Walsh"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0101991/","name":"Philippa Boyens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001392/","name":"Peter Jackson"}],"duration":"PT3H7M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
Ridikove hronike
programme.desc: The Chronicles of Riddick: Directed by David Twohy. With Vin Diesel, Colm Feore, Thandiwe Newton, Judi Dench. The wanted criminal Richard Bruno Riddick (Vin Diesel) arrives on a planet called Helion Prime and finds himself up against an invading empire called the Necromongers, an army that plans to convert or kill all humans in the universe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0296572/","name":"The Chronicles of Riddick","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzBjNmJkYjUtMTFjMC00ZWI5LWEyM2YtNzczOTczMmM1ODY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1ODk3MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"The wanted criminal Richard Bruno Riddick (Vin Diesel) arrives on a planet called Helion Prime and finds himself up against an invading empire called the Necromongers, an army that plans to convert or kill all humans in the universe.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0296572/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mjohnston10-1"},"dateCreated":"2005-03-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great Scifi action flick","reviewBody":"I would also like to comment on the fact that TCOR received bad reviews. Personally, I think that Vin Diesel should continue making the movies from the other screenplays that have already been written. The plot in these films (TCOR and Pitch Black) is actually quite original. From an action standpoint, the films do not lack anything. Riddick is the bad ass anti-hero that we would all like to be sometimes and they couldn't have cast the parts any better. There are some similarities between the Necros in TCOR and the Borg in the latter Star Trek movies, but who cares? David Twohy put a great spin on the Necro collective and I am eagerly awaiting another sequel. Anyone who likes Scifi and enjoys fantastic visuals will love this movie.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":222279,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2004-09-22","keywords":"shared universe,actor reprises previous role,movie flop,timeframe 27th century,warrior","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004874/","name":"Vin Diesel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001132/","name":"Judi Dench"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0272173/","name":"Colm Feore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0878638/","name":"David Twohy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026886/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0923646/","name":"Jim Wheat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003117/","name":"Ken Wheat"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0878638/","name":"David Twohy"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Weekend at Bernie's
Vikend s mrtvacem
programme.desc:
Weekend at Bernie's: Directed by Ted Kotcheff. With Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart, Terry Kiser. Two losers try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, leading the hitman to attempt to track him down to finish him off." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098627/","name":"Weekend at Bernie's","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgwN2QxODItOTcwZS00ZDA1LThjYzUtZTI5NWI3YWY4ZjM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE5MjUyOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two losers try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, leading the hitman to attempt to track him down to finish him off.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"billybrown41"},"dateCreated":"2002-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"very enjoyable semi-black comedy","reviewBody":"Maybe I'm just stupid, but I love this movie. I still remember when it came out and maybe it's just nostalgia because I watched it so many times when I was nine years old, but I still enjoy watching it. It does a pretty good job at catching the look and feel of the late 80s. All the hairstyles and clothing are pretty dated but to me, that's all part of the fun. 

 It all starts when our guys, Richard and Larry, discover a $2 million insurance fraud scam in their company. When they report it to their boss, Bernie (Terry Kiser) he seems grateful and invites them to his beach house for labor day weekend. As it turns out, Bernie is the one doing the scamming and has hired a mob hitman to take them out. Little does Bernie know, that the mob has decided that Bernie has been a little too careless and they have decided to take him out instead. So, by the time Richard and Larry reach the island, they discover that Bernie is dead from what looks like a drug-overdose. Instead of calling the cops, the less than bright Larry, decides it better to pretend that he didn't die. This will work since all of the island partyers are pretty self-absorbed and clueless. This is where it starts getting funny.

Since the hitman is still on the island, he keeps seeing Bernie, who he thought he killed and keeps re-killing him. It's hilarious, because the boys really don't have a clue that the hitman is even around. Watching them lug a dead corpse around, making him look alive, is one of the highlights. The fact that all of the islanders believe he's alive is even funnier. One of my favorite parts of the movie was Andrew McCarthy's performance as Larry. His slacker part killed me and he has some really funny lines. What ever happened to him? Jonathan Silverman also does a great job with an underwritten part. He plays the ulcer-bound Richard who SO tries to be the moral center of the situation. Terry Kiser is incredible, as always and he plays a dead guy VERY well. Some of the stuff that he has to do, I really can't see anyone else pulling off as well. My favorite scenes came when Bernie was alive. The guy is such an unbelievable jerk, he's actually fun to hate. 

Ignore the other comments on here, and go get this one. It's great for some laughs and I STILL get a lot out of it everytime I watch it. A great semi-black comedy. Go pick it up and look for the sequel. I enjoyed it as well, although not quite as much."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53540,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1989-07-05","keywords":"character name in title,black pantyhose,brunette woman,adult child lives at home,part of duology","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Weekend At Bernie's","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3137077529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JiMjg4MjctYzA0YS00OWVlLTlmMGItZjA1N2U4MzgxYjNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JiMjg4MjctYzA0YS00OWVlLTlmMGItZjA1N2U4MzgxYjNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000530/","name":"Andrew McCarthy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001738/","name":"Jonathan Silverman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0829252/","name":"Catherine Mary Stewart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467646/","name":"Ted Kotcheff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0728154/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458228/","name":"Robert Klane"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0098627, Title: Weekend at Bernie's, --- Description: Weekend at Bernie's: Directed by Ted Kotcheff. With Andrew McCarthy, Jonathan Silverman, Catherine Mary Stewart, Terry Kiser. Two losers try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, leading the hitman to attempt to track him down to finish him off." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098627/","name":"Weekend at Bernie's","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgwN2QxODItOTcwZS00ZDA1LThjYzUtZTI5NWI3YWY4ZjM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE5MjUyOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two losers try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, leading the hitman to attempt to track him down to finish him off.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098627/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"billybrown41","dateCreated":"2002-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"very enjoyable semi-black comedy","reviewBody":"Maybe I'm just stupid, but I love this movie. I still remember when it came out and maybe it's just nostalgia because I watched it so many times when I was nine years old, but I still enjoy watching it. It does a pretty good job at catching the look and feel of the late 80s. All the hairstyles and clothing are pretty dated but to me, that's all part of the fun. 

 It all starts when our guys, Richard and Larry, discover a $2 million insurance fraud scam in their company. When they report it to their boss, Bernie (Terry Kiser) he seems grateful and invites them to his beach house for labor day weekend. As it turns out, Bernie is the one doing the scamming and has hired a mob hitman to take them out. Little does Bernie know, that the mob has decided that Bernie has been a little too careless and they have decided to take him out instead. So, by the time Richard and Larry reach the island, they discover that Bernie is dead from what looks like a drug-overdose. Instead of calling the cops, the less than bright Larry, decides it better to pretend that he didn't die. This will work since all of the island partyers are pretty self-absorbed and clueless. This is where it starts getting funny.

Since the hitman is still on the island, he keeps seeing Bernie, who he thought he killed and keeps re-killing him. It's hilarious, because the boys really don't have a clue that the hitman is even around. Watching them lug a dead corpse around, making him look alive, is one of the highlights. The fact that all of the islanders believe he's alive is even funnier. One of my favorite parts of the movie was Andrew McCarthy's performance as Larry. His slacker part killed me and he has some really funny lines. What ever happened to him? Jonathan Silverman also does a great job with an underwritten part. He plays the ulcer-bound Richard who SO tries to be the moral center of the situation. Terry Kiser is incredible, as always and he plays a dead guy VERY well. Some of the stuff that he has to do, I really can't see anyone else pulling off as well. My favorite scenes came when Bernie was alive. The guy is such an unbelievable jerk, he's actually fun to hate. 

Ignore the other comments on here, and go get this one. It's great for some laughs and I STILL get a lot out of it everytime I watch it. A great semi-black comedy. Go pick it up and look for the sequel. I enjoyed it as well, although not quite as much.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53540,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1989-07-05","keywords":"character name in title,black pantyhose,brunette woman,adult child lives at home,part of duology","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Weekend At Bernie's","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3137077529","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JiMjg4MjctYzA0YS00OWVlLTlmMGItZjA1N2U4MzgxYjNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JiMjg4MjctYzA0YS00OWVlLTlmMGItZjA1N2U4MzgxYjNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000530/","name":"Andrew McCarthy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001738/","name":"Jonathan Silverman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0829252/","name":"Catherine Mary Stewart"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467646/","name":"Ted Kotcheff"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0728154/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458228/","name":"Robert Klane"],"duration":"PT1H37M"</script><metacontent="

Two losers try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, leading the hitman to attempt to track him down to finish him off." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098627/","name":"Weekend at Bernie's","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDgwN2QxODItOTcwZS00ZDA1LThjYzUtZTI5NWI3YWY4ZjM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjE5MjUyOTM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two losers try to pretend that their murdered employer is really alive, leading the hitman to attempt to track him down to finish him off.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"billybrown41"},"dateCreated":"2002-04-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"very enjoyable semi-black comedy","reviewBody":"Maybe I'm just stupid, but I love this movie. I still remember when it came out and maybe it's just nostalgia because I watched it so many times when I was nine years old, but I still enjoy watching it. It does a pretty good job at catching the look and feel of the late 80s. All the hairstyles and clothing are pretty dated but to me, that's all part of the fun. 

 It all starts when our guys, Richard and Larry, discover a $2 million insurance fraud scam in their company. When they report it to their boss, Bernie (Terry Kiser) he seems grateful and invites them to his beach house for labor day weekend. As it turns out, Bernie is the one doing the scamming and has hired a mob hitman to take them out. Little does Bernie know, that the mob has decided that Bernie has been a little too careless and they have decided to take him out instead. So, by the time Richard and Larry reach the island, they discover that Bernie is dead from what looks like a drug-overdose. Instead of calling the cops, the less than bright Larry, decides it better to pretend that he didn't die. This will work since all of the island partyers are pretty self-absorbed and clueless. This is where it starts getting funny.

Since the hitman is still on the island, he keeps seeing Bernie, who he thought he killed and keeps re-killing him. It's hilarious, because the boys really don't have a clue that the hitman is even around. Watching them lug a dead corpse around, making him look alive, is one of the highlights. The fact that all of the islanders believe he's alive is even funnier. One of my favorite parts of the movie was Andrew McCarthy's performance as Larry. His slacker part killed me and he has some really funny lines. What ever happened to him? Jonathan Silverman also does a great job with an underwritten part. He plays the ulcer-bound Richard who SO tries to be the moral center of the situation. Terry Kiser is incredible, as always and he plays a dead guy VERY well. Some of the stuff that he has to do, I really can't see anyone else pulling off as well. My favorite scenes came when Bernie was alive. The guy is such an unbelievable jerk, he's actually fun to hate. 

Ignore the other comments on here, and go get this one. It's great for some laughs and I STILL get a lot out of it everytime I watch it. A great semi-black comedy. Go pick it up and look for the sequel. I enjoyed it as well, although not quite as much."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":53540,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1989-07-05","keywords":"character name in title,black pantyhose,brunette woman,adult child lives at home,part of duology","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Weekend At Bernie's","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3137077529","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JiMjg4MjctYzA0YS00OWVlLTlmMGItZjA1N2U4MzgxYjNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JiMjg4MjctYzA0YS00OWVlLTlmMGItZjA1N2U4MzgxYjNkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000530/","name":"Andrew McCarthy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001738/","name":"Jonathan Silverman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0829252/","name":"Catherine Mary Stewart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467646/","name":"Ted Kotcheff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0728154/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0458228/","name":"Robert Klane"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Secret Life of Bees
Tajni život pčela
programme.desc: The Secret Life of Bees: Directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood. With Dakota Fanning, Queen Latifah, Jennifer Hudson, Alicia Keys. In 1964, a teenage girl in search of the truth about her mother runs away to a small town in South Carolina and finds a family of independent women who can connect her to her past." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0416212/","name":"The Secret Life of Bees","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTgzNDIzMTM2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTQzNTE4MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 1964, a teenage girl in search of the truth about her mother runs away to a small town in South Carolina and finds a family of independent women who can connect her to her past.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0416212/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kirkfam-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-10-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"wonderful movie","reviewBody":"I'm not sure why this film got such a bad rating....it's truly one of the nicest films I've seen in a long time! I brought my daughter to see the movie today -- we both had tears in our eyes throughout the movie. The acting was superb, as was the casting. Normally I like to read the book before seeing a movie, as usually the book is so much better. I am glad that my daughter talked me into going to this movie. I think cinematically, it was one of the prettiest movies I've seen in awhile. You are taken from laughing one moment to feeling as though your heart is being tugged out of your body in the next moment. I will definitely be recommending this film to my friends!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":25715,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-10-17","keywords":"f rated,cake,neglected child,psychological abuse,freedom","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Secret Lives of Bees: Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2605646105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNjk0NTM4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTY3MTczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAxNjk0NTM4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTY3MTczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the first theatrical trailer for The Secret Lives of Bees, directed by Gina Prince-Bythewood."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266824/","name":"Dakota Fanning"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1617685/","name":"Jennifer Hudson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001451/","name":"Queen Latifah"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0697656/","name":"Gina Prince-Bythewood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072775/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0001946/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0697656/","name":"Gina Prince-Bythewood"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1650330/","name":"Sue Monk Kidd"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: True Story
Istinita priča
programme.desc:
True Story: Directed by Rupert Goold. With Jonah Hill, James Franco, Felicity Jones, Maria Dizzia. When disgraced New York Times reporter Michael Finkel meets accused killer Christian Longo - who has taken on Finkel's identity - his investigation morphs into a game of cat-and-mouse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2273657/","name":"True Story","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWM2ODc1MGYtYjNkMC00MTQ0LTk1ZWYtYWVjYTg3MzhiZWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUzOTUwMTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"When disgraced New York Times reporter Michael Finkel meets accused killer Christian Longo - who has taken on Finkel's identity - his investigation morphs into a game of cat-and-mouse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2273657/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"d_vsbrgh"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"True Story comes up short","reviewBody":"True Story is based on the novel by Mike Finkel recounting his relationship with Christian Longo(James Franco), a man accused of murdering his wife and three children. Finkel(Jonah Hill)is a young up and coming journalist writing for the New York Times when his career is derailed after he plays a little fast and loose with some facts of a recently published article. While trying to plan the next chapter in his professional life he receives a call from a reporter looking to get an angle on the story about Longo. It seems that he was using Finkel's identity when he was captured in Mexico. Finkel is naturally curious but also smells a story that could put his career back on track.

Finkel and Longo arrange to meet and what follows are a series of meetings where both men engage in a dialogue meant to extract as much information as possible from the other. But how much of what Longo shares is the truth? How does Finkel use the information he gets?

The main problem with this movie is the pay-off, or the lack thereof. The story is simply not as interesting as it sounds. Honestly, it's no ones fault. The direction by first timer Rupert Goold is solid, well paced, and true to the story. The acting is good even if it is a little weird to see Hill and Franco together in serious roles. The best way to describe it might be we all know someone(friend or family member) who is excited to tell a story of something that happened to them or something they witnessed and when they are done, looking to you for a reaction, all you can say is "Is that it?"

The most compelling aspect of the film is Finkel coming to grips with the fact that he has to determining what is the truth and what is a lie. Not unlike his readers had to do after reading his last story for the Times. One liar interrogating another.

In the end, the build up leads to very little. The ride was interesting but the destination was a big disappointment.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":66894,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-17","keywords":"journalist,murder trial,prison visit,discredited reporter,investigative journalism","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi111980057","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzI1MTA3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk2MzU3MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzI1MTA3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk2MzU3MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drama centered around the relationship between journalist Michael Finkel and Christian Longo, an FBI Most Wanted List murderer who for years lived outside the U.S. under Finkel's name.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428065/","name":"Felicity Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3734458/","name":"Rupert Goold"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136967/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3734458/","name":"Rupert Goold"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1738734/","name":"David Kajganich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4927379/","name":"Michael Finkel"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: True Story
Istinita priča
programme.desc:
True Story: Directed by Rupert Goold. With Jonah Hill, James Franco, Felicity Jones, Maria Dizzia. When disgraced New York Times reporter Michael Finkel meets accused killer Christian Longo - who has taken on Finkel's identity - his investigation morphs into a game of cat-and-mouse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2273657/","name":"True Story","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZWM2ODc1MGYtYjNkMC00MTQ0LTk1ZWYtYWVjYTg3MzhiZWFlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUzOTUwMTk@._V1_.jpg","description":"When disgraced New York Times reporter Michael Finkel meets accused killer Christian Longo - who has taken on Finkel's identity - his investigation morphs into a game of cat-and-mouse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2273657/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"d_vsbrgh"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"True Story comes up short","reviewBody":"True Story is based on the novel by Mike Finkel recounting his relationship with Christian Longo(James Franco), a man accused of murdering his wife and three children. Finkel(Jonah Hill)is a young up and coming journalist writing for the New York Times when his career is derailed after he plays a little fast and loose with some facts of a recently published article. While trying to plan the next chapter in his professional life he receives a call from a reporter looking to get an angle on the story about Longo. It seems that he was using Finkel's identity when he was captured in Mexico. Finkel is naturally curious but also smells a story that could put his career back on track.

Finkel and Longo arrange to meet and what follows are a series of meetings where both men engage in a dialogue meant to extract as much information as possible from the other. But how much of what Longo shares is the truth? How does Finkel use the information he gets?

The main problem with this movie is the pay-off, or the lack thereof. The story is simply not as interesting as it sounds. Honestly, it's no ones fault. The direction by first timer Rupert Goold is solid, well paced, and true to the story. The acting is good even if it is a little weird to see Hill and Franco together in serious roles. The best way to describe it might be we all know someone(friend or family member) who is excited to tell a story of something that happened to them or something they witnessed and when they are done, looking to you for a reaction, all you can say is "Is that it?"

The most compelling aspect of the film is Finkel coming to grips with the fact that he has to determining what is the truth and what is a lie. Not unlike his readers had to do after reading his last story for the Times. One liar interrogating another.

In the end, the build up leads to very little. The ride was interesting but the destination was a big disappointment.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":66894,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-17","keywords":"journalist,murder trial,prison visit,discredited reporter,investigative journalism","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi111980057","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzI1MTA3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk2MzU3MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzI1MTA3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDk2MzU3MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A drama centered around the relationship between journalist Michael Finkel and Christian Longo, an FBI Most Wanted List murderer who for years lived outside the U.S. under Finkel's name.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1706767/","name":"Jonah Hill"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0428065/","name":"Felicity Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3734458/","name":"Rupert Goold"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0136967/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3734458/","name":"Rupert Goold"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1738734/","name":"David Kajganich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4927379/","name":"Michael Finkel"}],"duration":"PT1H39M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jack Frost
Snežni tata
programme.desc:
Jack Frost: Directed by Troy Miller. With Michael Keaton, Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross, Mark Addy. A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0141109/","name":"Jack Frost","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTE4YWIzNjItZWNhNi00Y2E1LTgyODktMTUzM2ZkMmJlNDFlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzYzMzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A father who can't keep his promises dies in a car accident. One year later, he returns as a snowman who has the final chance to put things right with his son before he is gone forever.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0141109/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"michaelsibley416"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"very heart-warming","reviewBody":"I will never understand why so many viewers dislike "Jack Frost." It is a movie with heart warming and refreshing storyline. Michael Keaton stars as Jack Frost in this awesome movie about getting a second chance at being the world's greatest dad. Kelly Preston, Joseph Cross and Mark Addy co-star.

I first noticed Joseph Cross, Charlie Frost, in the 100th episode of "Touched By An Angel" and since then I knew he was a talented young actor. Cross once again teamed with Keaton in "Desperate Measures" another awesome movie overlooked by the viewing audience.

"Jack Frost" is the kind of movie that has heart-warming moments intertwined with comedic wit. Keaton and Cross seem to have a lot of fun making this movie together and it showed in their performances. Scenes like the one that had Jack Frost throwing snowballs at the school bully and his friends as well as the chase that followed made it all worthwhile to see because this is what makes movies so good.

Watching this movie, it reminded me of "Ghost" because of its sweeping and heartwarming storyline.

Chemistry is one of the elements I look for in a great movie. "Jack Frost" has this element and more. While an unusual but a brilliant pairing, Keaton and Preston bring chemistry to "Jack Frost," a movie that seems to be better than others I've seen before.

I think Michael Keaton is one of the best actors I've seen and his performance in "Jack Frost" is one of his best films to date so WATCH it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35736,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Family"],"datePublished":"1998-12-11","keywords":"character name as title,two word title,movie flop,altered version of studio logo,jack frost character","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Jack Frost","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3282567449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVkNjE0YTMtMzJmMS00NmYyLTgxZjYtMGM0YjU1NTZhMTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000474/","name":"Michael Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000593/","name":"Kelly Preston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0189200/","name":"Joseph Cross"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003474/","name":"Troy Miller"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0025311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425756/","name":"Mark Steven Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089237/","name":"Steve Bloom"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0731271/","name":"Jonathan Roberts"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
Upoznajte Džo Bleka
programme.desc:
Meet Joe Black: Directed by Martin Brest. With Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins, Claire Forlani, Jake Weber. Death, who takes the form of a young man, asks a media mogul to act as a guide to teach him about life on Earth, and in the process, he falls in love with his guide's daughter." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119643/","name":"Meet Joe Black","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0MzRmMTgtMTk4OS00MzdkLWJjNWMtZWJmZjlkYTI0YWRiL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Death, who takes the form of a young man, asks a media mogul to act as a guide to teach him about life on Earth, and in the process, he falls in love with his guide's daughter.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119643/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Pork_Scratchings"},"dateCreated":"2000-01-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the best films of 1998, I can't praise this film enough!","reviewBody":"I must admit to have been slightly hesistant when I first heard about Meet Joe Black because of the subject matter and its length, however I found this film to be superb.

The acting was believable, the cinematography of the film was well thought out and extremely picturesque. The soundtrack by Thomas Newman (the Shawshank Redemption) went from chilling to the most beautiful melodies that I have ever heard (giving, in my humble opinion, any classical composer a run for their money), adding an extra depth to this film.

There are no in-betweens in this film: you WILL either love or hate this film. However, I can say that this film is one of the most uplifting and life affirming movies that I have ever seen. It left me both moved and confident that the world was not such a bad place after all. Just like the Shawshank Redemption told us that hope is not a bad thing, so Meet Joe Black tells us that indeed love can conquer all better than Titanic ever could.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":229526,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"1998-11-13","keywords":"death,birthday,wealth,death personified,fear of death","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000093/","name":"Brad Pitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000164/","name":"Anthony Hopkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001231/","name":"Claire Forlani"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000976/","name":"Martin Brest"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045196/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0651592/","name":"Ron Osborn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0719734/","name":"Jeff Reno"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0905458/","name":"Kevin Wade"}],"duration":"PT2H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ovo malo duse
Ovo malo duše
programme.desc: Ovo malo duse: Directed by Ademir Kenovic. With Branko Djuric, Boro Stjepanovic, Zaim Muzaferija, Sasa Petrovic. A bitter coming-of-age story about boy who grows up in a remote Bosnian village shortly after the WW II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0279213/","name":"Ovo malo duse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyNTVjNDYtMDM3OC00ZTMzLTk0MzAtZDgwNTg1NjQxOWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1NDIxMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bitter coming-of-age story about boy who grows up in a remote Bosnian village shortly after the WW II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0279213/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"requiem-8"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The devil gave a man this little bit of soul to make him suffer.","reviewBody":"In a small Bosnian village, a young boy is facing the hardness of a poor life, the death of his mother and the abrupt ending of his youth. This Drama shows a Muslim boy preparing for a traditional wedding to fulfill his mothers last wish. He follows the traditions in order to become a man. Ordinary happenings, funny and sad at the same time, full of nostalgia for something so close, but still, far far away. This is the first feature movie of the director Ademir Kenovic. It shows the traditional way of life in post WW2 Bosnia. Its hard not to like this movie, especially for people who are conscious about the hardness of reality.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":691,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1987-02-16","keywords":"railway,village,bosnia,yugoslavia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0229301/","name":"Branko Djuric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830655/","name":"Boro Stjepanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0616225/","name":"Zaim Muzaferija"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0448632/","name":"Ademir Kenovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050591/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057374/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102492/","name":"Ranko Bozic"}],"duration":"PT1H18M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zemaljski dani teku
Zemaljski dani teku
programme.desc: Zemaljski dani teku: Directed by Goran Paskaljevic. With Dimitrije Vujovic, Obren Helcer, Sarlota Pesic, Mila Keca. An old sea captain has lived on his own as long as he has been able to. Between his pension and the portraits he paints for a little spending money, he has done all right. However, the day finally comes when he must enter an old age home. Nothing daunted, his high spirits and zest for living infect the whole home with enthusiasm as they prepare a New Year's Eve party for visiting relatives. Even the captain's withdrawn and sour old roommate at the home eventually joins in." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0174353/","name":"Zemaljski dani teku","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmE4ZmJhNjktYTQ4My00Y2QyLTk3MDUtYTMyZjk4OGNlMzY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","description":"An old sea captain has lived on his own as long as he has been able to. programme.desc: A3 - Rock'n'Roll uzvraca udarac: Directed by Petar Pasic. With Nikola Pejakovic, Srdjan 'Zika' Todorovic, Uros Djuric, Zlatko Rakonjac. Angel and the Devil fight for the soul of a Belgrade rocker, that he can't survive in the body of an old punker." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0820117/","name":"A3 - Rock'n'Roll uzvraca udarac","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWY1YTFiNWMtZmRlMC00NWE1LTk1YzQtMTJiNTg1ZWU1N2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTgxOTUwMTI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Angel and the Devil fight for the soul of a Belgrade rocker, that he can't survive in the body of an old punker.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0820117/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Alternative-rocker"},"dateCreated":"2010-02-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"awesome movie","reviewBody":"This is an awesome movie and anyone who doesn't think so is either dumb or doesn't understand Serbian humor. Everyone says that the first part was the best but i think that this one is. It's a comedy about musicians and it has everything a comedy should have. You just have to understand the way Serbian people think. You can't say it's a bad movie if you didn't grow up watching and listening to this kind of stuff. Don't get me wrong . I'm not saying that you have to be Serbian in order to understand this movie. This is a movie for the whole world and i recommend it to everyone. programme.title: Dogodilo se na danasnji dan
Dogodilo se na današnji dan
programme.desc:
Dogodilo se na danasnji dan: Directed by Miroslav Lekic. With Zarko Lausevic, Srdjan 'Zika' Todorovic, Olja Beckovic, Nebojsa Bakocevic. Belgrade in 1963. In a yard surrounded by buildings, a group of young people of different backgrounds and social status, but of similar views about love and self-affirmation, spend their time together. Their friendship is dyed with various events typical for socialism, such as working actions or Youth Day's parade. All what happens within this yard may become an allegory of one generation's destiny." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0181498/","name":"Dogodilo se na danasnji dan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2I3Nzc3YmMtZGIzNS00YWUwLTg5Y2QtMjY5ODllNjM2Mzg0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc0MTYwMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Belgrade in 1963. Laugh and a seriosity. It has been so many times on TV, I don t know, I think many, many filmofils have watched it.

The great actors, for some of them one of the first movies. The people from ex - Yugoslavia know when hear: Zarko Lausevic, Srdjan Todorovic, Zoran Cvijanovic, Vesna Trivalic, etc that it is quality film.

You will laugh, focus on Srdjan Todorovic ( Males ),

but it isn t a comedy, at the end of the movie, you get serious! A Belgrade neighbourhood: the main characters are 18 - 25 years old, young people. Growing up, love problems,social problems... 

A realistic story, the 70-es in Belgrade...

I strongly recommend it! programme.title: Ovo malo duse
Ovo malo duše
programme.desc: Ovo malo duse: Directed by Ademir Kenovic. With Branko Djuric, Boro Stjepanovic, Zaim Muzaferija, Sasa Petrovic. A bitter coming-of-age story about boy who grows up in a remote Bosnian village shortly after the WW II." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0279213/","name":"Ovo malo duse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTAyNTVjNDYtMDM3OC00ZTMzLTk0MzAtZDgwNTg1NjQxOWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ1NDIxMDQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A bitter coming-of-age story about boy who grows up in a remote Bosnian village shortly after the WW II.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0279213/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"requiem-8"},"dateCreated":"2006-01-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"The devil gave a man this little bit of soul to make him suffer.","reviewBody":"In a small Bosnian village, a young boy is facing the hardness of a poor life, the death of his mother and the abrupt ending of his youth. This Drama shows a Muslim boy preparing for a traditional wedding to fulfill his mothers last wish. He follows the traditions in order to become a man. Ordinary happenings, funny and sad at the same time, full of nostalgia for something so close, but still, far far away. This is the first feature movie of the director Ademir Kenovic. It shows the traditional way of life in post WW2 Bosnia. Its hard not to like this movie, especially for people who are conscious about the hardness of reality.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":691,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1987-02-16","keywords":"railway,village,bosnia,yugoslavia","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0229301/","name":"Branko Djuric"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830655/","name":"Boro Stjepanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0616225/","name":"Zaim Muzaferija"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0448632/","name":"Ademir Kenovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050591/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057374/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102492/","name":"Ranko Bozic"}],"duration":"PT1H18M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zemaljski dani teku
Zemaljski dani teku
programme.desc: Zemaljski dani teku: Directed by Goran Paskaljevic. With Dimitrije Vujovic, Obren Helcer, Sarlota Pesic, Mila Keca. An old sea captain has lived on his own as long as he has been able to. Between his pension and the portraits he paints for a little spending money, he has done all right. However, the day finally comes when he must enter an old age home. Nothing daunted, his high spirits and zest for living infect the whole home with enthusiasm as they prepare a New Year's Eve party for visiting relatives. programme.title: Nacionalna klasa
Nacionalna klasa
programme.desc:
Nacionalna klasa: Directed by Goran Markovic. With Dragan Nikolic, Bogdan Diklic, Gorica Popovic, Rade Markovic. One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. He lives a carefree life of a Belgrade dandy boy, neglecting his girlfriend, avoiding his draft calls, and refusing to deal with any life responsibility in general. The decisive race on Saturday is only what he cares about." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079606/","name":"Nacionalna klasa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQ3ZTFkYWItNTIxNC00ZGJlLTgyZWUtZmViNTgyNzRiNmE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","description":"One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. He lives a carefree life of a Belgrade dandy boy, neglecting his girlfriend, a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079606/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Decko_koji_obecava"},"dateCreated":"2002-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very enjoyable","reviewBody":"This film should be an example to young Serbian directors of today (Raso Andricu, are you listening) on how to make a quality light, youth-oriented movie.

"Nacionalna klasa" is basically about a young man's reluctance to grow up. It stars Dragan Nikolic as Brana Mitrovic a.k.a. Floyd, a part-time race car driver and full-time freeloader. He's 27, still living with his parents and gives an impression of someone who hasn't put in too many hard working days in his life. Movie follows him through 7 key days of his life during which he:


* tries to weasel out of mandatory military service by faking a kidney disease, 



* frantically looks for money to buy new tires for his Zastava Fiat as he's got a big race on the weekend, 



* is informed by his girlfriend Vukosava a.k.a. Silja (Gorica Popovic) with whom he maintains a very casual relationship that she's pregnant with his kid and wants to break up, etc, etc...


Movie introduces a bunch of supporting characters too, of whom the most memorable are Mile rent-a-bubreg (Bogdan Diklic) and an eternal film student (played by Aleksandar Bercek) at the Faculty of Dramatic Arts who seems to have it in for famous Spanish surrealist director Luis Bunuel. The right ratio of comedy vs. poignancy is maintained throughout, as to avoid the movie becoming either too frivolous or too preachy.

Will our flawed hero finally become a responsible adult or will he continue his womanizing, mooching and free-spending ways? Well, the movie doesn't say since this is not the kind of major transformation that happens over such a short period but by the end of the flick Floyd definitely doesn't look a care-free guy he did in the beginning of it.

As an aside, it is interesting to watch mid-to-late 1970s Belgrade in the background. This was a definite heyday of the communist, foreign-loan-fueled la dolce vita in Yugoslavia. National basketball team was winning European, World and Olympic titles, people were going to Trieste, Italy on weekend shopping pilgrimages in search of fashionable western merchandise and Goran Bregovic & 'Bijelo dugme' were introducing the mass appeal of rock'n'roll to Yugoslav youth. Unfortunately it didn't last, a slow but steady downhill ride commenced soon afterwards, culminating in what the entire world saw play out in the Balkans during the 1990s."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3581,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"1979-01-09","keywords":"driver,rain,on the run,mud,male female relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631877/","name":"Dragan Nikolic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0226699/","name":"Bogdan Diklic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691419/","name":"Gorica Popovic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Virdzina
Virdžina
programme.desc: Virdzina: Directed by Srdjan Karanovic. With Miodrag Krivokapic, Marta Keler, Inka Gogálová, Igor Bjelan. "Virgina" tells a tale from the end of the 19th century. It took place in a isolated village near the Adriatic Sea. Because of the extreme patriarchal culture there is a superstition that families without male heirs are cursed. When the wife of a farmer gives birth to their fourth daughter, father decides that the child will become a so-called "Virgina" and that she will live as a man, so that she can work and be the family heir. This heartbreaking story of Virgina's life is told with strong words, augmented with harsh environment." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0105761/","name":"Virdzina","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODVmNDc3ZTUtZDk3Ny00MjJjLWE5ZjgtMjJjMTU1MzZmY2U4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","description":""Virgina" tells a tale from the end of the 19th century. It took place in a isolated village near the Adriatic Sea. Because of the extreme patriarchal culture there is a superstition that families without male heirs are cursed. When ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0105761/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"itends-here"},"dateCreated":"2010-12-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amazing film","reviewBody":"The idea of this film is quite original and intriguing. I watched it for the first time about a year ago and I now consider it one of my favourite films of all time. As an English speaker, the Serbian dialogue/necessity of subtitles did not take anything from my enjoyment, as it added to the otherworldly, minimalistic atmosphere. After being flooded with Hollywood sensationalism, a film like this is extremely refreshing- dramatic but not melodramatic. It is honest and beautiful. The focus is on the internal and external struggles of the characters instead of action and visual effects. I found myself brought to tears by the plight of the protagonist; I would recommend this to anyone who likes foreign films, GLBT films (as it shows a different aspect of gender identity), or "slow", thoughtful dramas.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":507,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"1991-04-05","keywords":"superstition,village,farmer,sexual identity,gender confusion","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0471771/","name":"Miodrag Krivokapic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445447/","name":"Marta Keler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0324632/","name":"Inka Gogálová"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438906/","name":"Srdjan Karanovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016788/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065791/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0438906/","name":"Srdjan Karanovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0547719/","name":"Milosav Marinovic"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dnevnik uvreda 1993

programme.title: Zone of the Dead
Zona mrtvih
programme.desc: Zone of the Dead: Directed by Milan Konjevic, Milan Todorovic. With Ken Foree, Kristina Klebe, Emilio Roso, Miodrag 'Miki' Krstovic. InterPol agents must join forces with dangerous prisoner to fight zombie hordes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1191971/","name":"Zone of the Dead","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3NTM0MDk0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTI3NTY1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"InterPol agents must join forces with dangerous prisoner to fight zombie hordes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1191971/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"panosdial"},"dateCreated":"2013-01-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could have been better","reviewBody":"This one is another zombie flick from a non-Hollywood production. In the passed years we have seen so many movies based on the contamination-turns- men-to-zombies from around the world (even Thailand). To be honest, this particular movie could have been much better 'cause the atmosphere is good and creepy, the zombies are greatly done and the action is OK. But all this package is ruined by the poor (to non-existent) performance of the actors/actresses and the bad -not to say crap- lines. BUT -yes there is a BUT here- if you're a fan of those bloodthirsty creatures called zombies, walkers etc and you love to see shooting, chopping and all the relevant stuff these movies produce and provide, you can gather some friends, make some popcorn, watch it and then, turn off your DVD and just forget about it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3198,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2010-02-05","keywords":"psychotronic film,skeleton,interpol agent,train,police officer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"2012: Apocalypse of the Dead","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi995858713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MDQyMjE4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTgwNDczMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MDQyMjE4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTgwNDczMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"InterPol agents must join forces with dangerous prisoner to fight zombie hordes."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0286010/","name":"Ken Foree"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1640351/","name":"Kristina Klebe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1705473/","name":"Emilio Roso"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2238286/","name":"Milan Konjevic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1188066/","name":"Milan Todorovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0231347/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172421/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0217471/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1188739/","name":"Vukota Brajovic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2238286/","name":"Milan Konjevic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1188066/","name":"Milan Todorovic"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Nacionalna klasa
Nacionalna klasa
programme.desc:
Nacionalna klasa: Directed by Goran Markovic. With Dragan Nikolic, Bogdan Diklic, Gorica Popovic, Rade Markovic. One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. He lives a carefree life of a Belgrade dandy boy, neglecting his girlfriend, avoiding his draft calls, and refusing to deal with any life responsibility in general. The decisive race on Saturday is only what he cares about." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0079606/","name":"Nacionalna klasa","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWQ3ZTFkYWItNTIxNC00ZGJlLTgyZWUtZmViNTgyNzRiNmE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTAwNjUxNTkz._V1_.jpg","description":"One week in a life of Branimir Mitrovic "Floyd", a young rally driver from the National Class (up to 785cc), dreaming of promotion to the higher category. He lives a carefree life of a Belgrade dandy boy, neglecting his girlfriend, a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0079606/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Decko_koji_obecava"},"dateCreated":"2002-07-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very enjoyable","reviewBody":"This film should be an example to young Serbian directors of today (Raso Andricu, are you listening) on how to make a quality light, youth-oriented movie.

"Nacionalna klasa" is basically about a young man's reluctance to grow up. It stars Dragan Nikolic as Brana Mitrovic a.k.a. Floyd, a part-time race car driver and full-time freeloader. He's 27, still living with his parents and gives an impression of someone who hasn't put in too many hard working days in his life. Movie follows him through 7 key days of his life during which he:


* tries to weasel out of mandatory military service by faking a kidney disease, 



* frantically looks for money to buy new tires for his Zastava Fiat as he's got a big race on the weekend, 



* is informed by his girlfriend Vukosava a.k.a. Silja (Gorica Popovic) with whom he maintains a very casual relationship that she's pregnant with his kid and wants to break up, etc, etc...


Movie introduces a bunch of supporting characters too, of whom the most memorable are Mile rent-a-bubreg (Bogdan Diklic) and an eternal film student (played by Aleksandar Bercek) at the Faculty of Dramatic Arts who seems to have it in for famous Spanish surrealist director Luis Bunuel. The right ratio of comedy vs. poignancy is maintained throughout, as to avoid the movie becoming either too frivolous or too preachy.

Will our flawed hero finally become a responsible adult or will he continue his womanizing, mooching and free-spending ways? Well, the movie doesn't say since this is not the kind of major transformation that happens over such a short period but by the end of the flick Floyd definitely doesn't look a care-free guy he did in the beginning of it.

As an aside, it is interesting to watch mid-to-late 1970s Belgrade in the background. This was a definite heyday of the communist, foreign-loan-fueled la dolce vita in Yugoslavia. National basketball team was winning European, World and Olympic titles, people were going to Trieste, Italy on weekend shopping pilgrimages in search of fashionable western merchandise and Goran Bregovic & 'Bijelo dugme' were introducing the mass appeal of rock'n'roll to Yugoslav youth. Unfortunately it didn't last, a slow but steady downhill ride commenced soon afterwards, culminating in what the entire world saw play out in the Balkans during the 1990s."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3581,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"1979-01-09","keywords":"driver,rain,on the run,mud,male female relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0631877/","name":"Dragan Nikolic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0226699/","name":"Bogdan Diklic"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691419/","name":"Gorica Popovic"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049004/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0548648/","name":"Goran Markovic"}],"duration":"PT1H45M"}</script><metacontent="
