programme.title: 30 Minutes or Less
30 minuta Ili Manje
programme.desc:
30 Minutes or Less: Directed by Ruben Fleischer. With Jesse Eisenberg, Danny McBride, Aziz Ansari, Nick Swardson. Two fledgling criminals kidnap a pizza delivery guy, strap a bomb to his chest, and inform him that he has mere hours to rob a bank or else..." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1622547/","name":"30 Minutes or Less","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM5NjM0ODY1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjk5NjI0Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two fledgling criminals kidnap a pizza delivery guy, strap a bomb to his chest, and inform him that he has mere hours to rob a bank or else...","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1622547/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"grantss"},"dateCreated":"2016-10-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Silly, but fun","reviewBody":"Dwayne (played by Danny McBride) and Travis (Nick Swardson) hire a hit-man to kill Dwayne's father, as he recently won the lottery and they want to open a massage parlour. The hit-man isn't cheap, so to pay the $100,000 he demands for the job, they kidnap a pizza delivery guy, Nick (Jesse Eisenberg), strap a bomb to him and tell him they will blow him up unless he robs a bank and brings them at least $100,000. Then things get weird...

Silly, but fun. Plot is ridiculous, but the movie is carried by the over-the-topness of the performances, especially those of Danny McBride and Aziz Ansari. Very funny, especially McBride and Ansari's dialogue.

Jesse Eisenberg plays the straight guy to McBride and Ansari's antics, and does a good job. Nick Swardson is perfect as McBride's sidekick. Good support from Michael Pena, Dilshad Vadsaria and Fred Ward.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98363,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2011-08-12","keywords":"unlikely criminal,strapped to a bomb,pizza delivery boy,sony vaio,heist gone wrong","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi563780633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzkyNDUxNzY0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE2ODYyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzkyNDUxNzY0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTE2ODYyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two fledgling criminals (McBride and Swardson) kidnap pizza delivery guy Nick (Eisenberg), strap a bomb to his chest, and inform him that he has mere hours to rob a bank. As the clock ticks, Nick, with the help of his ex-best friend, Chet (Ansari), deal with the police, hired assassins, flamethrowers, and their own tumultuous relationship."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0251986/","name":"Jesse Eisenberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1144419/","name":"Danny McBride"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0841910/","name":"Nick Swardson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0281508/","name":"Ruben Fleischer"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0194736/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039303/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2225652/","name":"Michael Diliberti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3574030/","name":"Matthew Sullivan"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 30 minuta Ili Manje
programme.desc: Nik (Džesi Ajzengebr) radi kao raznosač pica u malom gradu, a njegov svakodnevni život se, u ovoj akcionoj komediji, ukršta sa velikim planovima dvojice kriminalaca u pokušaju. Nik je dostavljač pice iz gradića čiji svakodnevni život prekinu krupni planovi dvojice nadobudnih kriminalnih veleumova. Oni otimaju Nika i privežu mu bombu na telo - s obećanjem da će ga razneti ako ne opljačka banku. Nik ima samo nekoliko sati da izvede nemogući zadatak, pa za pomoć zamoli nekadašnjeg najboljeg prijatelja Četa. Dok sat otkucava, njih dvojica moraju izaći na kraj s policijom, plaćenim ubicama, bacačima plamena i ličnim burnim prijateljstvom.

It's not brilliant, but it isn't bad.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130137,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-02-08","keywords":"credit card,odd couple,male female friendship,impersonator,rental car","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"U.S. Version #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi618833689","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwMjU0NTQxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTY3OTY4OA@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQwMjU0NTQxN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTY3OTY4OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a mild-mannered businessman learns his identity has been stolen, he hits the road in an attempt to foil the thief -- a trip that puts him in the path of a deceptively harmless-looking woman.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000867/","name":"Jason Bateman","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565250/","name":"Melissa McCarthy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0158626/","name":"John Cho"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1164861/","name":"Seth Gordon"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0369082/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0235528/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373437/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0563301/","name":"Craig Mazin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1087085/","name":"Jerry Eeten"],"duration":"PT1H51M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Down to Earth
Ponovo na Zemlji
programme.desc: Down to Earth: Directed by Chris Weitz, Paul Weitz. With Chris Rock, Regina King, Chazz Palminteri, Eugene Levy. After dying before his time, an aspiring black comic gets a second shot at life - by being placed in the body of a wealthy white businessman." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0231775/","name":"Down to Earth","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNmODQ5N2QtMzEwMy00MjRmLWE1MzEtZmUyZmQ3ZmIzYmMwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"After dying before his time, an aspiring black comic gets a second shot at life - by being placed in the body of a wealthy white businessman.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0231775/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tomrito"},"dateCreated":"2001-03-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Needs some help","reviewBody":"This movie is a remake of two movies that were a lot better. The last one, Heaven Can Wait, was great, I suggest you see that one. This one is not so great. The last third of the movie is not so bad and Chris Rock starts to show some of the comic fun that got him to where he is today. However, I don't know what happened to the first two parts of this movie. It plays like some really bad "B" movie where people sound like they are in some bad TV sit-com. The situations are forced and it is like they are just trying to get the story over so they can start the real movie. It all seems real fake and the editing is just bad. I don't know how they could release this movie like that. Anyway, the last part isn't to bad, so wait for the video and see it then.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":23539,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2001-02-16","keywords":"remake,adulterous wife,psychotronic film,disguised as homeless person,heaven","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Down to Earth","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2460156185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNkYjZjYTktMDA2My00YTgyLWE0YTAtZjJjZDEzNjQ4Y2JjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjNkYjZjYTktMDA2My00YTgyLWE0YTAtZjJjZDEzNjQ4Y2JjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Paramount"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001674/","name":"Chris Rock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005093/","name":"Regina King"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001590/","name":"Chazz Palminteri"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919363/","name":"Chris Weitz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0919369/","name":"Paul Weitz"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0070636/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049706/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0026180/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0561938/","name":"Elaine May"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000886/","name":"Warren Beatty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001674/","name":"Chris Rock"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pitch Perfect 2
Pitch Perfect 2: Na putu do zvezda
programme.desc:
Pitch Perfect 2: Directed by Elizabeth Banks. With Anna Kendrick, Rebel Wilson, Hailee Steinfeld, Brittany Snow. After a humiliating command performance at The Kennedy Center, the Barden Bellas enter an international competition that no American group has ever won in order to regain their status and right to perform." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2848292/","name":"Pitch Perfect 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzk4OTM2NzMzNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTAzNDE0NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After a humiliating command performance at The Kennedy Center, the Barden Bellas enter an international competition that no American group has ever won in order to regain their status and right to perform.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2848292/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elliotdyers"},"dateCreated":"2015-06-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"After a humiliating performance at the Lincoln Centre, the Barden Bellas have to battle for their rights to perform.","reviewBody":"Hilarious, wacky and smart are only some of the words that best describe Pitch Perfect 2. Taking place 3 years after the original, this film did have some high expectations to live up too. The humour as well as the strong female characters involved created something with little to complain about. Sexist jokes such as 'Woman are about as good at a coppella as they are at being doctors' said by John (John Michael Higgins) to then be put down by such comments like 'crack a Book, John' said by Gail (Elizabeth Banks), is displaying woman power. The film did a good job at not living up to the hype, with many critics dubbing the film to be better than the first. But like we all know, films with hype generally don't live up to expectations, turning a film from a success to a shamble in weeks. Thanks to many of the original cast reigniting their roles in this film, it meant for a quick and easy introduction, with all the characters already built and back stories set. 

Beca (Anna Kendrick) has worked her way up from the first film, with her natural and powerful singing ability; we see her rise from the new comer in the original to the leader in Pitch Perfect 2. We see her leadership and her desire to achieving her real goal in life, whilst being the figurehead for all of the other girls to follow. Fat Amy (Rebel Wilson) has recreated her role from the original in a much more humorous and creative way, being the main supplier of laughs throughout the film, from her sexual antics to her denial of love she is always throwing laughs at us, giving us the feeling of 'I wish she was my friend'. Jason Moore didn't continue his role as director in the sequel, leaving the job to Elizabeth Bank to direct and act in this hilarious sequel. Although during the end performance, there is obvious and silly CGI green screens that even the least of film nerds would be able to reorganise, granted this isn't just down to the director, but the lack of a 'Perfect' special effect expert. However you can't take away the excellent choreography and excellent screen direction that she produced, with the breath taking dancing and the powerful voices, you are fully entertained throughout each performance, if it's the plot changing performance or if its when Amy decides to serenade the man of her dreams. The film doesn't change much from the first film, with a similar plot line and the use of the same scenes during the film, like the group showdown where they have to blurt out songs without compromise for them to lose only too their main competition, showing the lack of creativity by the writers.

Beca and Fat Amy both stealing the stage with their support acts Chloe (Brittany Snow) and Lilly (Hana Mea Lee) not far behind left little room for the new characters to grow, leaving characters such as Flo (Chrissie Fit) as a nameless character that you just remember as 'The New One'. Down too the fact that she wasn't a very fun character and didn't have the personality to out shines the outrageous Amy. 

Pitch Perfect 2 starts 3 years after the original, meaning that many of the girls are in their final year of college. However Chloe (Brittany Snow) who was one of the main Barden Bella's in the first had actually been at college for 7 years, without no thought of what she was going to do after and knowing what she was even doing at college. This was a plot hole in the film that overall didn't have many, however the nature of her role in the film, you get past the fact that she is a bit of a sado who doesn't want to leave her life and go into real world.

The performances put on by the Barden Bella's where much better in this one, but it had to be because the competition was a lot better, although the plot was similar but on a larger level it still gave us lots of laughs throughout, weather it help the story or didn't. The story wasn't very strong and you could tell that the ideas where lacking throughout the film. You could always tell that they were going to bring out an amazing performance to try achieving their goal, making the film lack in excitement and emotion.

Where the film lacks in plot it makes up in humour, giving you laughs throughout the whole film, with there wacky yet clever jokes. The film has not moved on much from the original with the plot being basically the without the build-up to allow characters to grow. Although it has some flaws that with more creative writers could have been avoided, it is still a good watch to have a laugh with friends.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":150854,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Music"],"datePublished":"2015-05-15","keywords":"f rated,sequel,a cappella,reference to philippines,triple f rated","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Global Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1579003417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc2ODI0MjA3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTE0MTE0NDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc2ODI0MjA3OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTE0MTE0NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After getting suspended from the ICCAs, the Barden Bellas must win the World Championships -- an international competition that no American team has ever won -- in order to be reinstated.
"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0447695/","name":"Anna Kendrick"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2313103/","name":"Rebel Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2794962/","name":"Hailee Steinfeld"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006969/","name":"Elizabeth Banks"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0283926/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076476/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0134224/","name":"Kay Cannon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3015467/","name":"Mickey Rapkin"}],"duration":"PT1H55M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Daddy's Home 2
Tata je kod kuće 2
programme.desc: Daddy's Home 2: Directed by Sean Anders. With Will Ferrell, Mark Wahlberg, Mel Gibson, John Lithgow. Having finally gotten used to each other's existence, Brad and Dusty must now deal with their intrusive fathers during the holidays." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5657846/","name":"Daddy's Home 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDA4Nzc1OTg2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODE3ODgwNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Having finally gotten used to each other's existence, Brad and Dusty must now deal with their intrusive fathers during the holidays.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5657846/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"deloudelouvain"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"If you don't like Will Ferrell just don't watch this movie and stop whining about it","reviewBody":"Why the haters would even start watching this movie is a mystery to me. If you don't like Will Ferrell then just don't watch this movie because it is the same humor as in all the other movies he's been in. I love Will Ferrell and his stupid humor with his nerdy face, so to me this is a good movie. I thought it was even better then the first one. This time John Lidgow is also in the cast and that's another comedian that makes me laugh all the time. They couldn't have found a better guy to play the father of Will Ferrell. Mel Gibson as the father of Mark Whalberg was also a good match. The story might be a bit dorky but I didn't expect anything else. It's all about the silly humor, and if you're not into that, just skip this movie instead of wasting your time twice by watching it and writing a bad review about it. I love Will Ferrell and his stupid humor with his nerdy face, so to me this is a good movie. I thought it was even better then the first one. This time John Lidgow is also in the cast and that's another comedian that makes me laugh all the time. They couldn't have found a better guy to play the father of Will Ferrell. Mel Gibson as the father of Mark Whalberg was also a good match. The story might be a bit dorky but I didn't expect anything else. programme.title: Boreg
Boreg
programme.desc: Boreg: Directed by Shira Geffen. With Sarah Adler, Samira Saraya, Doraid Liddawi, Na'ama Shoham. Self Made tells the story of two women - one Israeli, the other Palestinian- who are trapped within their respective worlds. After a mix-up at a checkpoint, they find themselves living the life of the other on the opposite side of the border." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3751304/","name":"Boreg","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTg3Zjc4MGMtNGExZi00ZGYwLTgwMDMtY2Y3MzUxYTI0YmFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjMyMzI4MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Self Made tells the story of two women - one Israeli, the other Palestinian- who are trapped within their respective worlds. After a mix-up at a checkpoint, they find themselves living the life of the other on the opposite side of th","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3751304/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Nozz"},"dateCreated":"2015-05-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice work, but does break a rule here and there","reviewBody":"Shira Geffen was on TV explaining that although she knows it's customary to say what a film is about in a single sentence, she can't say clearly what this film of her own is about. But fools rush in, so I'll say that the gist is in what the protagonist, an artist, is heard saying about her own work: that it explores what happens when people confront the impossibility of undoing what they've done. In this particular case, a woman who can't live with what she's done breaks out of herself-- into amnesia, to begin with. Her adventures, absurd and occasionally amusing, are interleaved with those of an Arab counterpart. Naturally we expect them to cross paths, and they do; but some other narrative conventions are violated and we're left to wonder whether this is the way that Geffen's inspiration works or whether she is trying to pass off a failure to achieve proper narrative as a leap into higher art beyond it. The audience I was with seemed pleased by each episode but disappointed that the episodes didn't add up. Other than the plot, the backgrounds must be remarked on-- some strikingly peppered expanses of color and of grey, and some Beckettesque desert nothingness with a border-crossing in the middle like one of those free-standing doors in a Warner Brothers cartoon landscape. All in all, I found the movie pleasing and somewhat similar to Geffen's previous film (Jellyfish) although unhappier behind its flashes of wackiness.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":218,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-30","keywords":"f rated,one word title","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012239/","name":"Sarah Adler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3297302/","name":"Samira Saraya"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3561877/","name":"Doraid Liddawi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0311700/","name":"Shira Geffen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0267486/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0037930/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0311700/","name":"Shira Geffen"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Sous les jupes des filles: Directed by Audrey Dana. With Isabelle Adjani, Alice Belaïdi, Laetitia Casta, Audrey Dana. A story about 11 women living in Paris. Each of them has her own problems: career, love life, children. Every woman has her complexes and virtues. They always look elegant, hiding their inner feelings. Will they reach all their goals and overcome all their difficulties?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3098306/","name":"Sous les jupes des filles","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2Q4MTIzMGUtMzhiMy00ODVlLWE4NjktYTk5NDk2MjlhMjU0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ0MzExODU@._V1_.jpg","description":"A story about 11 women living in Paris. Will they reach all their goals","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3098306/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2016-05-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"What women want","reviewBody":"Obviously not only one thing (though one thing they do want is similar to something men want too). But as another reviewer stated, as ridiculous as this gets sometimes, it never loses its focus. Yes it's supposed to be funny, but we rather laugh with the characters than about them. It may be closer to a woman's heart, but if you are open (sexually and spiritually speaking), you will enjoy this.\n\nBut while there's not much nudity to speak of, there's a lot of sexual tension which some might have issues with. It's kind of like an update to Sex and the City. And way better than a movie called The Women that came out a couple of years ago. programme.title: Yume
Snovi
programme.desc: Yume: Directed by Akira Kurosawa, Ishirô Honda. With Akira Terao, Mitsuko Baishô, Toshie Negishi, Mieko Harada. A collection of tales based upon eight of director Akira Kurosawa's recurring dreams." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100998/","name":"Yume","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDBkODdjMzEtNTY1NC00ZWQ5LTk3NDUtY2IwMTk5MzhmNTUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A collection of tales based upon eight of director Akira Kurosawa's recurring dreams.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100998/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mariafefauk"},"dateCreated":"2005-07-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautifully made and achieved","reviewBody":"I was pleasantly surprised with dreams, not only in terms of content but also aesthetically. There are very few films that manage to embody personal, local and global concerns as Akira Kurosava has managed in this production. There are so many underlying topics that it is difficult to concentrate in just a few for the purpose of this review, but I believe it is fair to say that Dreams portrays our individual and collective dreams and nightmares, reflecting that sometimes what we dream of today is what will keep us awake tomorrow. A nice range of representations of concerns from the deepest and most personal childhood worries and fantasies to the more complex issues of mental illness, extreme ambition, destruction of our environment and death. In all I recommend this film to anyone who has the chance to see it, It is possible that Dreams may not appeal to a mainstream audience in terms of content because there is a lot of symbolism and critical engagement but the photography and sceneries are for sure something that should not go amiss for anyone. If you get the chance it is truly worth giving it your time, a fantastic experience.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":25611,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"1990-05-25","keywords":"japanese boy,japanese woman,japanese mother,mother son relationship,sandal","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Akira Kurosawa's Dreams","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi105028633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzg1MzEwZmItMDM0MS00YTBhLTk5M2MtYWJlNzQzYWZkYmZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzg1MzEwZmItMDM0MS00YTBhLTk5M2MtYWJlNzQzYWZkYmZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0855417/","name":"Akira Terao"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0047963/","name":"Mitsuko Baishô"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0624383/","name":"Toshie Negishi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000041/","name":"Akira Kurosawa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393094/","name":"Ishirô Honda"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054092/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000041/","name":"Akira Kurosawa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0393094/","name":"Ishirô Honda"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0100998, Title: Yume, --- Description: Yume: Directed by Akira Kurosawa, Ishirô Honda. With Akira Terao, Mitsuko Baishô, Toshie Negishi, Mieko Harada. A collection of tales based upon eight of director Akira Kurosawa's recurring dreams." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100998/","name":"Yume","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDBkODdjMzEtNTY1NC00ZWQ5LTk3NDUtY2IwMTk5MzhmNTUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A collection of tales based upon eight of director Akira Kurosawa's recurring dreams.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100998/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mariafefauk","dateCreated":"2005-07-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautifully made and achieved","reviewBody":"I was pleasantly surprised with dreams, not only in terms of content but also aesthetically. There are very few films that manage to embody personal, local and global concerns as Akira Kurosava has managed in this production. There are so many underlying topics that it is difficult to concentrate in just a few for the purpose of this review, but I believe it is fair to say that Dreams portrays our individual and collective dreams and nightmares, reflecting that sometimes what we dream of today is what will keep us awake tomorrow. A nice range of representations of concerns from the deepest and most personal childhood worries and fantasies to the more complex issues of mental illness, extreme ambition, destruction of our environment and death. In all I recommend this film to anyone who has the chance to see it, It is possible that Dreams may not appeal to a mainstream audience in terms of content because there is a lot of symbolism and critical engagement but the photography and sceneries are for sure something that should not go amiss for anyone. The night things start going w","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0415932/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paul2001sw-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cool, but lacking in angst","reviewBody":"A cool thriller with a supernatural air, 'Lemming' has much to commend it, including a walk on role (so to speak) for the Pic du Midi d'Osseau, one of my favourite Pyrennean mountains. The story is actually quite limited, but M. Pollock and his wife both make an interesting pair of monsters and a frighteningly believable couple, and the movie's four-handed structure pits them nicely against the model pairing of the hero and his wife. Ultimately, it might have been better had the lemmings of the title seemed more connected to the meat of the story; but the acting is good, even if the hero is just a little too reserved for us to really feel his angst.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5106,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-05-11","keywords":"volkswagen beetle,suburb,lemming,suicide,murder","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524217/","name":"Laurent Lucas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001250/","name":"Charlotte Gainsbourg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001648/","name":"Charlotte Rampling"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0596962/","name":"Dominik Moll"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057624/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545382/","name":"Gilles Marchand"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0596962/","name":"Dominik Moll"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Popiól i diament
Pepeo i dijamant
programme.desc:
Popiól i diament: Directed by Andrzej Wajda. With Zbigniew Cybulski, Ewa Krzyzewska, Waclaw Zastrzezynski, Adam Pawlikowski. As WWII and the German occupation ends, the Polish resistance and the Russian forces turn on each other in an attempt to take over leadership in Communist Poland." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0052080/","name":"Popiól i diament","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY3NmI0MmQtYTI0MC00OTkxLThmYTYtMTc1MWQ3NWFiYmY3L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"As WWII and the German occupation ends, the Polish resistance and the Russian forces turn on each other in an attempt to take over leadership in Communist Poland.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0052080/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jmurphy-11"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"An essential historical film and visual masterpiece","reviewBody":""Ashes and Diamonds" is both an essential historical film and a visual masterpiece. Set in the first days of Soviet occupation following World War II, the film examines the moral dilemmas of the protagonist, Maciek--a young rebel hit-man-- in following through with the assassination of a leading communist party member--Sczcuka--who will soon be empowered as a means of forming a puppet communist government in Poland. The film is not limited to the perspective of the protagonist, and alternates between the moral dilemmas of each of the characters in fulfilling predetermined Soviet agendas in the formation of a communist Poland. 

The visual composition of the film is as masterful as the complexity of the characters and plot. Despite the notoriously bad film technology in the Soviet states and the constraints of Socialist Realism, the film manages not only to capture the potential richness of black and white, but also manages to avoid the standard pitfalls of over-zealous editing that often destroy other contemporary Soviet films. The frames are longer shots in general, and forced schematization through editing is all but absent. The precise composition of each scene throughout the film provides the visual coherency that would otherwise be imposed by careful editing; as an example, see the scene in which Maciek is underneath the staircase in the lobby of the hotel towards the end of the film, or the final "Polish" dance scene. 

I would highly recommend some research into the political transitions of Poland in the years directly following WWI before viewing this film for the first time; this film was made for a particular audience who clearly understood certain cultural and historical references that a modern Western audience will inevitably miss (ie. "Were you in Warsaw?"). The thematic and emotional complexity of the film is also enhanced by an understanding of Polish history. I would highly recommend this film for any class examining Eastern Europe or Soviet Russia (which is the context in which I was introduced to this film in particular), or to anyone who would like to better understand the complexity of Cold War politics from a perspective behind the Iron Curtain.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11623,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"1958-10-03","keywords":"1940s,resistance movement,world war two,soviet troops,russian abroad","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194193/","name":"Zbigniew Cybulski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0473109/","name":"Ewa Krzyzewska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953664/","name":"Waclaw Zastrzezynski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906667/","name":"Andrzej Wajda"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016599/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029156/","name":"Jerzy Andrzejewski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906667/","name":"Andrzej Wajda"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

I would highly recommend some research into the political transitions of Poland in the years directly following WWI before viewing this film for the first time; this film was made for a particular audience who clearly understood certain cultural and historical references that a modern Western audience will inevitably miss (ie. "Were you in Warsaw?"). The thematic and emotional complexity of the film is also enhanced by an understanding of Polish history. I would highly recommend this film for any class examining Eastern Europe or Soviet Russia (which is the context in which I was introduced to this film in particular), or to anyone who would like to better understand the complexity of Cold War politics from a perspective behind the Iron Curtain.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11623,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"1958-10-03","keywords":"1940s,resistance movement,world war two,soviet troops,russian abroad","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194193/","name":"Zbigniew Cybulski","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0473109/","name":"Ewa Krzyzewska","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953664/","name":"Waclaw Zastrzezynski"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906667/","name":"Andrzej Wajda"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016599/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029156/","name":"Jerzy Andrzejewski","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906667/","name":"Andrzej Wajda"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Place Vendôme
Place Vendome
programme.desc: Place Vendôme: Directed by Nicole Garcia. With Catherine Deneuve, Jean-Pierre Bacri, Emmanuelle Seigner, Jacques Dutronc. Realising a dishonest deal has been found out a diamond merchant commits suicide, leaving the gems in question for his wife. Knowing the business from the time before drink largely took over her life, she decides to sober up and sell them herself. Though they attract much interest, no-one legitimate will touch them. As she tries to get her present life straight the lure of the stones means she may have to confront the past as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119901/","name":"Place Vendôme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NjY3MDAyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzEwOTg5._V1_.jpg","description":"Realising a dishonest deal has been found out a diamond merchant commits suicide, leaving the gems in question for his wife. Knowing the business from the time before drink largely took over her life, she decides to sober up and sell","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119901/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"writers_reign"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Girl's Best Friend","reviewBody":"I've been checking out the comments for this movie and am slightly surprised that no one has noted what appears to be a fairly obvious metaphor. Diamonds are cold, hard, many faceted and beautiful. Catherine Deneuve is the star here. I rest my case. There is, of course, more to it than that but not a lot more. It's French so it's stylish by definition but Nicole Garcia, like so many French actors/writers/directors, was born in Oran, Algeria - gateway to Lisbon and, by definition, a free world, as we learned in the first reel of 'Casablanca' - so there's also something of the outsider element, the shopgirl who came to the ball because her beauty captured the heart of the Second Son, and who feels always slightly uneasy that it all may end tomorrow. So, what do we get for our money? Style, opulence, quasi-noir, great acting. Is that enough? You tell me. 7/10"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2259,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1998-10-07","keywords":"drunkenness,flashback,betrayal,personal recovery,generational conflict","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Place Vendome","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1219428633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA4ZDBhNTQtNTljNS00ODg2LTg5ZDQtYjJiYWUxY2Q4NjhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA4ZDBhNTQtNTljNS00ODg2LTg5ZDQtYjJiYWUxY2Q4NjhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Wellspring"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0045870/","name":"Jean-Pierre Bacri"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0782561/","name":"Emmanuelle Seigner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305368/","name":"Nicole Garcia"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022244/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075023/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0276466/","name":"Jacques Fieschi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305368/","name":"Nicole Garcia"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jigokumon
Vrata pakla
programme.desc: Jigokumon: Directed by Teinosuke Kinugasa. With Kazuo Hasegawa, Machiko Kyô, Isao Yamagata, Yatarô Kurokawa. A samurai pursues a married lady-in-waiting." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0045935/","name":"Jigokumon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGI2NTY4OWMtZTU1NS00ZjY0LWE4YjMtYjE3MWQ0YTgzZTY3L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A samurai pursues a married lady-in-waiting.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0045935/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"zetes"},"dateCreated":"2002-08-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Nice colors, slow story, great climax","reviewBody":"A samurai falls in love with a woman whose life he saves. He is offered a reward for his bravery, and he asks if he can be married to that woman. Unfortunately, she is already married and the samurai's request cannot be fulfilled. He is steadfast in his desire, and tries forcibly to take her from her husband. The elements of many cheap thrillers exist in that scenario. Gate of Hell doesn't do too much to distinguish itself, although it's certainly not a thriller. Basically, the whole film is an excuse for its admittedly great climactic sequence, where the samurai invades the home of the woman and her husband at night. I really like how this sequence ends, but there are some questions left unanswered - annoyingly so. The husband even asks them aloud, and there really isn't a satisfactory explanation. Other than that sequence, most of the rest of the film is kind of tedious. Fortunately, the absolutely beautiful cinematography - was this Japan's first film in color? - always manages to be impressive. The costume design actually won an Academy Award, a much deserved one, if I may say so myself. It also won an honorary Oscar for Best Foreign Film, the year before that category was made official. Furthermore, it was the first Japanese film to win the Palme D'Or at Cannes. 7/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3556,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History"],"datePublished":"1953-10-31","keywords":"medieval times,japan,stalker,koto,murder","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0477553/","name":"Machiko Kyô"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0367928/","name":"Kazuo Hasegawa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0945299/","name":"Isao Yamagata"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0455938/","name":"Teinosuke Kinugasa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067278/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0452840/","name":"Kan Kikuchi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0455938/","name":"Teinosuke Kinugasa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0619211/","name":"Masaichi Nagata"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

The night things start going wrong." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0415932/","name":"Lemming","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIwMTk4MDY4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjY4OTI0Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After developing a flying web-cam Alain has his boss and wife over for dinner. The night things start going w","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0415932/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paul2001sw-1"},"dateCreated":"2008-12-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cool, but lacking in angst","reviewBody":"A cool thriller with a supernatural air, 'Lemming' has much to commend it, including a walk on role (so to speak) for the Pic du Midi d'Osseau, one of my favourite Pyrennean mountains. The story is actually quite limited, but M. Pollock and his wife both make an interesting pair of monsters and a frighteningly believable couple, and the movie's four-handed structure pits them nicely against the model pairing of the hero and his wife. Ultimately, it might have been better had the lemmings of the title seemed more connected to the meat of the story; but the acting is good, even if the hero is just a little too reserved for us to really feel his angst.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5106,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-05-11","keywords":"volkswagen beetle,suburb,lemming,suicide,murder","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524217/","name":"Laurent Lucas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001250/","name":"Charlotte Gainsbourg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001648/","name":"Charlotte Rampling"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0596962/","name":"Dominik Moll"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0057624/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0545382/","name":"Gilles Marchand"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0596962/","name":"Dominik Moll"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Popiól i diament
Pepeo i dijamant
programme.desc:
Popiól i diament: Directed by Andrzej Wajda. With Zbigniew Cybulski, Ewa Krzyzewska, Waclaw Zastrzezynski, Adam Pawlikowski. As WWII and the German occupation ends, the Polish resistance and the Russian forces turn on each other in an attempt to take over leadership in Communist Poland." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0052080/","name":"Popiól i diament","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY3NmI0MmQtYTI0MC00OTkxLThmYTYtMTc1MWQ3NWFiYmY3L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"As WWII and the German occupation ends, the Polish resistance and the Russian forces turn on each other in an attempt to take over leadership in Communist Poland.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0052080/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jmurphy-11"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"An essential historical film and visual masterpiece","reviewBody":""Ashes and Diamonds" is both an essential historical film and a visual masterpiece. Set in the first days of Soviet occupation following World War II, the film examines the moral dilemmas of the protagonist, Maciek--a young rebel hit-man-- in following through with the assassination of a leading communist party member--Sczcuka--who will soon be empowered as a means of forming a puppet communist government in Poland. The film is not limited to the perspective of the protagonist, and alternates between the moral dilemmas of each of the characters in fulfilling predetermined Soviet agendas in the formation of a communist Poland. 

The visual composition of the film is as masterful as the complexity of the characters and plot. Despite the notoriously bad film technology in the Soviet states and the constraints of Socialist Realism, the film manages not only to capture the potential richness of black and white, but also manages to avoid the standard pitfalls of over-zealous editing that often destroy other contemporary Soviet films. The frames are longer shots in general, and forced schematization through editing is all but absent. The precise composition of each scene throughout the film provides the visual coherency that would otherwise be imposed by careful editing; as an example, see the scene in which Maciek is underneath the staircase in the lobby of the hotel towards the end of the film, or the final "Polish" dance scene. 

I would highly recommend some research into the political transitions of Poland in the years directly following WWI before viewing this film for the first time; this film was made for a particular audience who clearly understood certain cultural and historical references that a modern Western audience will inevitably miss (ie. "Were you in Warsaw?"). The thematic and emotional complexity of the film is also enhanced by an understanding of Polish history. I would highly recommend this film for any class examining Eastern Europe or Soviet Russia (which is the context in which I was introduced to this film in particular), or to anyone who would like to better understand the complexity of Cold War politics from a perspective behind the Iron Curtain.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11623,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"1958-10-03","keywords":"1940s,resistance movement,world war two,soviet troops,russian abroad","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194193/","name":"Zbigniew Cybulski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0473109/","name":"Ewa Krzyzewska"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953664/","name":"Waclaw Zastrzezynski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906667/","name":"Andrzej Wajda"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016599/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029156/","name":"Jerzy Andrzejewski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906667/","name":"Andrzej Wajda"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0052080, Title: Popiól i diament, --- Description: Popiól i diament: Directed by Andrzej Wajda. With Zbigniew Cybulski, Ewa Krzyzewska, Waclaw Zastrzezynski, Adam Pawlikowski. As WWII and the German occupation ends, the Polish resistance and the Russian forces turn on each other in an attempt to take over leadership in Communist Poland." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0052080/","name":"Popiól i diament","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWY3NmI0MmQtYTI0MC00OTkxLThmYTYtMTc1MWQ3NWFiYmY3L2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4MjA5MzA@._V1_.jpg","description":"As WWII and the German occupation ends, the Polish resistance and the Russian forces turn on each other in an attempt to take over leadership in Communist Poland.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0052080/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jmurphy-11","dateCreated":"2005-10-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"An essential historical film and visual masterpiece","reviewBody":""Ashes and Diamonds" is both an essential historical film and a visual masterpiece. Set in the first days of Soviet occupation following World War II, the film examines the moral dilemmas of the protagonist, Maciek--a young rebel hit-man-- in following through with the assassination of a leading communist party member--Sczcuka--who will soon be empowered as a means of forming a puppet communist government in Poland. The film is not limited to the perspective of the protagonist, and alternates between the moral dilemmas of each of the characters in fulfilling predetermined Soviet agendas in the formation of a communist Poland. 

The visual composition of the film is as masterful as the complexity of the characters and plot. Despite the notoriously bad film technology in the Soviet states and the constraints of Socialist Realism, the film manages not only to capture the potential richness of black and white, but also manages to avoid the standard pitfalls of over-zealous editing that often destroy other contemporary Soviet films. The frames are longer shots in general, and forced schematization through editing is all but absent. The precise composition of each scene throughout the film provides the visual coherency that would otherwise be imposed by careful editing; as an example, see the scene in which Maciek is underneath the staircase in the lobby of the hotel towards the end of the film, or the final "Polish" dance scene. 

I would highly recommend some research into the political transitions of Poland in the years directly following WWI before viewing this film for the first time; this film was made for a particular audience who clearly understood certain cultural and historical references that a modern Western audience will inevitably miss (ie. "Were you in Warsaw?"). The thematic and emotional complexity of the film is also enhanced by an understanding of Polish history. I would highly recommend this film for any class examining Eastern Europe or Soviet Russia (which is the context in which I was introduced to this film in particular), or to anyone who would like to better understand the complexity of Cold War politics from a perspective behind the Iron Curtain.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11623,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance","War"],"datePublished":"1958-10-03","keywords":"1940s,resistance movement,world war two,soviet troops,russian abroad","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0194193/","name":"Zbigniew Cybulski","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0473109/","name":"Ewa Krzyzewska","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953664/","name":"Waclaw Zastrzezynski"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906667/","name":"Andrzej Wajda"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0016599/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029156/","name":"Jerzy Andrzejewski","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0906667/","name":"Andrzej Wajda"],"duration":"PT1H43M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Place Vendôme
Place Vendome
programme.desc: Place Vendôme: Directed by Nicole Garcia. With Catherine Deneuve, Jean-Pierre Bacri, Emmanuelle Seigner, Jacques Dutronc. Realising a dishonest deal has been found out a diamond merchant commits suicide, leaving the gems in question for his wife. Knowing the business from the time before drink largely took over her life, she decides to sober up and sell them herself. Though they attract much interest, no-one legitimate will touch them. As she tries to get her present life straight the lure of the stones means she may have to confront the past as well." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119901/","name":"Place Vendôme","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc4NjY3MDAyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNzEwOTg5._V1_.jpg","description":"Realising a dishonest deal has been found out a diamond merchant commits suicide, leaving the gems in question for his wife. Knowing the business from the time before drink largely took over her life, she decides to sober up and sell","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119901/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"writers_reign"},"dateCreated":"2004-04-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Girl's Best Friend","reviewBody":"I've been checking out the comments for this movie and am slightly surprised that no one has noted what appears to be a fairly obvious metaphor. Diamonds are cold, hard, many faceted and beautiful. Catherine Deneuve is the star here. I rest my case. There is, of course, more to it than that but not a lot more. It's French so it's stylish by definition but Nicole Garcia, like so many French actors/writers/directors, was born in Oran, Algeria - gateway to Lisbon and, by definition, a free world, as we learned in the first reel of 'Casablanca' - so there's also something of the outsider element, the shopgirl who came to the ball because her beauty captured the heart of the Second Son, and who feels always slightly uneasy that it all may end tomorrow. So, what do we get for our money? Style, opulence, quasi-noir, great acting. Is that enough? You tell me. 7/10"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2259,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1998-10-07","keywords":"drunkenness,flashback,betrayal,personal recovery,generational conflict","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Place Vendome","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1219428633","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA4ZDBhNTQtNTljNS00ODg2LTg5ZDQtYjJiYWUxY2Q4NjhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzA4ZDBhNTQtNTljNS00ODg2LTg5ZDQtYjJiYWUxY2Q4NjhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Wellspring"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0045870/","name":"Jean-Pierre Bacri"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0782561/","name":"Emmanuelle Seigner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305368/","name":"Nicole Garcia"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022244/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075023/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0276466/","name":"Jacques Fieschi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0305368/","name":"Nicole Garcia"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ekusute
Umeci za kosu
programme.desc: Ekusute: Directed by Sion Sono, Joe DiGiorgi, Tony Salerno. With Chiaki Kuriyama, Megumi Satô, Tsugumi, Eri Machimoto. About hair extensions that attack the women that wear them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0904049/","name":"Ekusute","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRiNWMwZDQtYTFmNi00MDIwLTk3ZTgtMDY4YjJhNWFjNzUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"About hair extensions that attack the women that wear them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0904049/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crossbow0106"},"dateCreated":"2008-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wild Ride","reviewBody":"This horror film is about cursed hair, that anyone who wears the hair extensions has something very bad happen to them. The hair is cursed because the women who had it were victims of organ harvesting. A morgue attendant brings a corpse which still grows hair and sells/gives the extensions. This is where the other part of the film comes in. Hair stylist apprentice Yuko (the pretty Chiaki Kuriyama) lives in a small apartment with a roommate Yuki. She also takes in her niece Mami (a very young girl played effectively by Miki Sato) who is suffering from abuse at the hands of Yuko's evil half sister. I like the way the film lives in two worlds and comes together. The special effects are pretty good and while there is violence there is little gore. This is a horror film with good production values and Ms. Kuriyama plays Yuko very well, very likable and sensible. If you like horror, especially J horror, you will like this film. While horror is not my favorite genre, I enjoyed this, it moved along well, never dragged and you care about Yuko and Mami. Thats enough of a ringing endorsement, and the film succeeds on many levels.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3001,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2007-02-17","keywords":"crying,deviant,tear,customer,stylist","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0475752/","name":"Chiaki Kuriyama"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1935082/","name":"Megumi Satô"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0875261/","name":"Tsugumi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0814469/","name":"Sion Sono"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1372679/","name":"Joe DiGiorgi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1002867/","name":"Tony Salerno"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073744/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0122174/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0814469/","name":"Sion Sono"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1329999/","name":"Masaki Adachi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2776563/","name":"Makoto Sanada"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0904049, Title: Ekusute, --- Description: Ekusute: Directed by Sion Sono, Joe DiGiorgi, Tony Salerno. With Chiaki Kuriyama, Megumi Satô, Tsugumi, Eri Machimoto. About hair extensions that attack the women that wear them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0904049/","name":"Ekusute","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGRiNWMwZDQtYTFmNi00MDIwLTk3ZTgtMDY4YjJhNWFjNzUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"About hair extensions that attack the women that wear them.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0904049/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"crossbow0106","dateCreated":"2008-10-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Wild Ride","reviewBody":"This horror film is about cursed hair, that anyone who wears the hair extensions has something very bad happen to them. The hair is cursed because the women who had it were victims of organ harvesting. A morgue attendant brings a corpse which still grows hair and sells/gives the extensions. This is where the other part of the film comes in. Hair stylist apprentice Yuko (the pretty Chiaki Kuriyama) lives in a small apartment with a roommate Yuki. She also takes in her niece Mami (a very young girl played effectively by Miki Sato) who is suffering from abuse at the hands of Yuko's evil half sister. I like the way the film lives in two worlds and comes together. The special effects are pretty good and while there is violence there is little gore. This is a horror film with good production values and Ms. Kuriyama plays Yuko very well, very likable and sensible. If you like horror, especially J horror, you will like this film. While horror is not my favorite genre, I enjoyed this, it moved along well, never dragged and you care about Yuko and Mami. Thats enough of a ringing endorsement, and the film succeeds on many levels.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3001,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2007-02-17","keywords":"crying,deviant,tear,customer,stylist","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0475752/","name":"Chiaki Kuriyama","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1935082/","name":"Megumi Satô","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0875261/","name":"Tsugumi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0814469/","name":"Sion Sono","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1372679/","name":"Joe DiGiorgi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1002867/","name":"Tony Salerno"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0073744/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0122174/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0814469/","name":"Sion Sono","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1329999/","name":"Masaki Adachi","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2776563/","name":"Makoto Sanada"],"duration":"PT1H48M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Fly
Muva
programme.desc: The Fly: Directed by Kurt Neumann. With David Hedison, Patricia Owens, Vincent Price, Herbert Marshall. A scientist has a horrific accident when he tries to use his newly invented teleportation device." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0051622/","name":"The Fly","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWRhMTY4NTgtYTljZi00ZGQzLWE3NWMtMmNjNzRkZmUyZjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A scientist has a horrific accident when he tries to use his newly invented teleportation device.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0051622/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SnoopyStyle"},"dateCreated":"2015-06-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"better than most 50s B-movie horrors","reviewBody":"In a Montreal machine shop, scientist Andre Delambre (Al Hedison) is found crush to death with his wife Helene (Patricia Owens) at the controls. She calls to confess to his brother Francois (Vincent Price). With the head crushed, Francois identifies the body with a long scar on his leg. Helene's confession seems suspicious and Andre's basement lab is trashed. Helene seems obsessed with flies and Francois pretends to have captured a white-headed fly. Helene recounts the story to him and Inspector Charas. Andre had succeeded in making a teleportation device.\n\nThis is much better than a simple 50's B-movie. The story is actually quite compelling. The acting is relatively good. Vincent Price is playing it straight. The production looks good. The directions are a little stiff which is the style of the day. It is still the story that is so great and the reveal is absolutely iconic.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22456,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1958-07-16","keywords":"science gone wrong,1950s,psychotronic film,low budget sci fi movie,transmogrification","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Fly (1958)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2809267993","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmNjZDRiZDMtMTQxMC00OWNhLWE1NTctNWExMzlhNTNmNjNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmNjZDRiZDMtMTQxMC00OWNhLWE1NTctNWExMzlhNTNmNjNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this horror starring Vincent Price"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0373314/","name":"David Hedison"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654433/","name":"Patricia Owens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001637/","name":"Vincent Price"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0627087/","name":"Kurt Neumann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068253/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165412/","name":"James Clavell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0486228/","name":"George Langelaan"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0051622, Title: The Fly, --- Description: The Fly: Directed by Kurt Neumann. With David Hedison, Patricia Owens, Vincent Price, Herbert Marshall. A scientist has a horrific accident when he tries to use his newly invented teleportation device." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0051622/","name":"The Fly","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWRhMTY4NTgtYTljZi00ZGQzLWE3NWMtMmNjNzRkZmUyZjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A scientist has a horrific accident when he tries to use his newly invented teleportation device.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0051622/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"SnoopyStyle","dateCreated":"2015-06-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"better than most 50s B-movie horrors","reviewBody":"In a Montreal machine shop, scientist Andre Delambre (Al Hedison) is found crush to death with his wife Helene (Patricia Owens) at the controls. She calls to confess to his brother Francois (Vincent Price). With the head crushed, Francois identifies the body with a long scar on his leg. Helene's confession seems suspicious and Andre's basement lab is trashed. Helene seems obsessed with flies and Francois pretends to have captured a white-headed fly. Helene recounts the story to him and Inspector Charas. Andre had succeeded in making a teleportation device.\n\nThis is much better than a simple 50's B-movie. The story is actually quite compelling. The acting is relatively good. Vincent Price is playing it straight. The production looks good. The directions are a little stiff which is the style of the day. It is still the story that is so great and the reveal is absolutely iconic.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22456,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1958-07-16","keywords":"science gone wrong,1950s,psychotronic film,low budget sci fi movie,transmogrification","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Fly (1958)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2809267993","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmNjZDRiZDMtMTQxMC00OWNhLWE1NTctNWExMzlhNTNmNjNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmNjZDRiZDMtMTQxMC00OWNhLWE1NTctNWExMzlhNTNmNjNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for this horror starring Vincent Price","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0373314/","name":"David Hedison","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654433/","name":"Patricia Owens","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001637/","name":"Vincent Price"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0627087/","name":"Kurt Neumann"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0068253/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0165412/","name":"James Clavell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0486228/","name":"George Langelaan"],"duration":"PT1H34M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Chase
Potera Bez Milosti
programme.desc: The Chase: Directed by Arthur Penn. With Marlon Brando, Jane Fonda, Robert Redford, E.G. Marshall. The escape of Bubber Reeves from prison affects the inhabitants of a small Southern town." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0060232/","name":"The Chase","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDYzYzQ1NDItMzU4Yi00ODNmLWIyNGEtNWNmMjJhZjY2MzdhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjUwNzk3NDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"The escape of Bubber Reeves from prison affects the inhabitants of a small Southern town.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0060232/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rupie"},"dateCreated":"1999-12-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"better than I expected","reviewBody":"The lukewarm reviews and comments led me to expect less than what I found in this decent movie of small-town corruption. Most of it is probably due to a pretty good cast - Brando is excellent, and Duvall, Dickinson, and E.G.Marshall put in good work. Redford's part is too small to do much with. I too was astounded at James Fox's pretty darn good Southern accent; it was so good that at first I couldn't place him, and then all those British roles came back to me in surprise. The script is ok too, and one would like to know more about the backstage fighting that went on over it between Hellman & company. The Panavision color is excellent; far better than what we have today. The portrayal of small-town bigotry, duplicity, jealousy, betrayal, and infidelity is well-done, and the spectacular junkyard Gotterdamerung is a chilling finale. The flick is definitely worth seeing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11518,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"Passed","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"1966-02-18","keywords":"manhunt,escaped convict,racism,woman in love with two men,southern u.s.","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi403684889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGM1YjJmNDctYjViYi00MjY5LWFlODUtY2Y0MDgxMDgxZDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGM1YjJmNDctYjViYi00MjY5LWFlODUtY2Y0MDgxMDgxZDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000008/","name":"Marlon Brando"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000404/","name":"Jane Fonda"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000602/","name":"Robert Redford"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0671957/","name":"Arthur Penn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0218910/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0285210/","name":"Horton Foote"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0375484/","name":"Lillian Hellman"}],"duration":"PT2H14M"}</script><metacontent="

Two safari tour-guides and business partners find in the African jungle a wandering stunning blonde who suffers from amnesia." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0075160/","name":"Safari Express","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDY5NjY3Mzk0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUyNDQzMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two safari tour-guides and business partners find in the African jungle a wandering stunning blonde who suffers from amnesia.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0075160/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Kirpianuscus"},"dateCreated":"2021-11-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"second part , same story","reviewBody":"It is just bizarre to comment too much about this second part of African Express. A slice of a very easy genre , having as target, more than precise, a predictable public of 1970. After decades, easy entertainement.
